questions.question: What is Medicurate Surgical's Mission?
questions.answer:
Medicurate Surgical's mission is to revolutionize the field of medical education through our award-winning [Human Anatomy VR](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fbfLqdhgOW4) software.

Our state-of-the-art product harnesses the power of Virtual Reality, Mixed Reality, and Augmented Reality to vividly present over 13,000 detailed anatomical structures, each with an in-depth description. It incorporates innovative features such as multi-user capability, providing an interactive and collaborative learning environment. With more than 1,500+ 3D VR cadavers, our platform offers a comprehensive and diverse range of anatomical exploration. Additionally, it includes a test management system, enhancing its utility as an educational tool by enabling the monitoring and assessment of learning progress.

This approach not only aids in a deeper understanding of human anatomy but also bridges the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical application.

We are the first company in the world to offer a complete anatomical 3D VR atlas with a [VR DICOM](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9zufDNWCaro) module in one product.

This advancement is in line with our mission to integrate pioneering technology into medical education. This feature allows users to spatially display patient data from CT or MRI scans with advanced features such as staining and slicing, providing a more immersive and detailed approach to understanding complex anatomy and pathology within medical imaging.

Ultimately, our mission at Medicurate Surgical is to provide innovative, technologically advanced tools that enrich the educational journey of medical students and professionals, preparing them for the challenges of modern healthcare with a focus on precision, detail, and practical application.

questions.question: Who is Human Anatomy VR designed for?
questions.answer:
Human Anatomy VR is designed for:

 - **Institutions**: Educational institutions can implement this technology as a teaching aid to supplement traditional anatomy education, providing an immersive experience that will enhance student learning outcomes.

 - **Professionals**: Healthcare professionals, including clinicians and surgeons, can utilize the detailed models for a fully-fledged environment that aids in professional development and patient education.

 - **Students**: Both medical students and high school students can use it as a learning tool to explore and understand human anatomy in a highly interactive and engaging way.

It is also perfect for sports, fitness & workout enthusiasts, science enthusiasts, and anybody interested in the human body.

Please [click here](https://youtu.be/fbfLqdhgOW4?si=cmFaDcDrxPWUj83N) to see the overview video.

questions.question: What types of educational institutions do you have medical content prepared for?
questions.answer:
Our team has expertly composed medical content suitable for two different levels of education:

 - University content level - Detailed content that matches the needs of a medical student who needs to prepare for their anatomical exams or a medical doctor.

 - High School content level - Simplified content for anybody curious about the human body.

questions.question: Who is VR DICOM designed for?
questions.answer:
VR DICOM is ideal for simulation centers, medical educators, students in medical and radiological fields, research institutions, medical professionals, and remote medical consultations. It's especially beneficial for immersive learning, detailed anatomical and pathological studies, patient visualizations and consultations, and medical staff training.

Please [click here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9zufDNWCaro&ab_channel=VIRTUALMEDICINE) to see the overview video.

questions.question: What do I need to use Human Anatomy VR?
questions.answer: Simply equip yourself with a VR headset, like the Meta Quest or PICO, or a VR-capable PC, to dive into an engaging, virtual exploration of [Human Anatomy VR](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fbfLqdhgOW4) or [VR DICOM](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9zufDNWCaro). No medical background or VR expertise is required to utilize Human Anatomy VR's anatomical atlas, thanks to its user-friendly design.

questions.question: As a student, what are the ways I can utilize Human Anatomy VR?
questions.answer:
If you are a student, you can use Human Anatomy VR to build your knowledge of the human body, including the 15 body systems and more than 13,000 structures with detailed descriptions, microscopic models, and movement animations.

You can also test yourself in quizzes and use many advanced tools to improve your studies.

questions.question: As a medical practitioner, what are the ways I can utilize Human Anatomy VR?
questions.answer:
Being a doctor or instructor allows you to leverage Human Anatomy VR to demonstrate and clarify the structure, function, and health-related aspects of each body system to your students or patients, by utilizing a virtual and interactive model in a VR session.

You can also create a test for your students or use tools such as stunning Antmode, where you shrink down to a smaller size and travel through the human body with students to assist you when teaching.

questions.question: What is Human Anatomy VR?
questions.answer:
Human Anatomy VR is a state-of-the-art 3D anatomical platform that leverages Virtual Reality, Mixed Reality, and Augmented Reality to bring to life over 13,000 detailed anatomical structures.

Designed for ease of use across various devices, it's an intuitive tool for students, professionals, and institutions worldwide. By simulating real-life dissections and offering interactive learning experiences, Human Anatomy VR significantly enhances the understanding and retention of complex anatomical details, making it a cutting-edge asset in the world of medical education.

Human Anatomy VR also disposes of a VR DICOM viewer, which allows the user spatial viewing of CT or MRI data with advanced features of coloring or cutting. The available institutional license enables a VR-shared experience between an instructor and authorized observers/students in a socially distanced format.

Please [click here](https://youtu.be/fbfLqdhgOW4?si=cmFaDcDrxPWUj83N) to see the overview video.

questions.question: What is VR DICOM?
questions.answer:
VR DICOM is Human Anatomy VR’s innovative extension, which can restore 2D CT and MRI scan series and create a 3D model that you can see in VR as if the patient were right in front of you.

The advanced Cutting feature allows you to cut the model in real-time in any plane to access all internal structures. You can also select highlight or hide any tissue type with the Windowing function. The available institutional license enables a VR-shared experience between an instructor and authorized observers/students in a socially distanced format.

Please [click here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9zufDNWCaro&ab_channel=VIRTUALMEDICINE) to see the overview video.

questions.question: Which license do I need to open DICOM Data?
questions.answer:
You need a Human Anatomy VR - [Essential VR](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/store/products/premium-vr-vVWY34ea) license to explore DICOM functionality. If you want to unlock the full potential of DICOM functionality, you will need a PC VR.

You can also view a limited number of DICOM images on Standalone VR devices (such as Meta Quest 3), but we strongly recommend PC VR for a better DICOM experience.

 For more information, contact us at: info@medicinevirtual.com

questions.question: Are multiple users able to access and use Human Anatomy VR or VR DICOM simultaneously?
questions.answer:
Yes, the Multi-User collaboration function allows you to create an online session and invite up to 100 participants to join the session for real-time interaction and discussion in the VR Room for Human Anatomy VR - [Essential VR](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/store/products/premium-vr-vVWY34ea) license. Please note:

- Multi-User mode requires each participant to have their own license (e.g., 10 users = 10 licenses)

- For creating VR sessions with more than 20 users at a time, you must first contact us at info@medicinevirtual.com

Each connected student and teacher has their own unique 3D Avatar, which they can individually personalize. Connected students can be seen and heard as if together in the same room – wherever in the world they are currently in.

questions.question: Is it possible for me to personalize the questions in an exam?
questions.answer: [Medicurate Surgical Portal](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/Account/Login) allows you to do that. You can log in and go to 'Test Manager' to select your questions for a test and add the customized quiz to an exam.

questions.question: Where can I find cross-section feature in Human Anatomy VR?
questions.answer: You can find the cross-section tool called 'Slice' in the tab Tools in a Hand Menu of the Human Anatomy VR app.

questions.question: Is it possible to create or join a multiplayer VR session using Wi-Fi?
questions.answer:
Yes, the Multi-User collaboration function allows you to create an online session and invite up to 100 participants to join the session for real-time interaction and discussion in the VR Room for Human Anatomy VR - [Essential VR](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/store/products/premium-vr-vVWY34ea) license (please note, for creating VR sessions with more than 20 users at a time, you must first contact us at info@medicinevirtual.com).

You can create an online meeting through the Internet, but you can also create a meeting through a local (LAN) shared VR Room as well.

questions.question: What types of licenses are available for Human Anatomy VR?
questions.answer:
Depending on your intended use - personal, professional, or institutional — we offer several types of licenses: 

- Personal License – for individual, non-commercial use (Personal license for one device, One license maximum) 

- Professional License – for patient education (Up to two professional licenses, each for one device)

- Institutional License – for universities, schools, and other organizations (Option for unlimited number of licenses)

Institutional license has two different types based on available features and advanced content: Basic VR and Essential VR. For more information, visit the [Medicurate Surgical Store](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/store).

questions.question: What is the difference between Human Anatomy VR for Personal Use and for Professionals?
questions.answer:
The Personal License is intended for individual, non-commercial use and includes access to all core anatomy features.

The Professional License is specifically tailored for healthcare professionals. It includes “VR DICOM preview”: enabling the ability to interact with DICOM files for patient education. For complete access to VR DICOM functionality and licensing details, reach out to us at info@medicinevirtual.com.

questions.question: What is the difference between Human Anatomy VR and Human Anatomy VR for Institutions?
questions.answer:
[Human Anatomy VR](https://www.meta.com/experiences/6643334382420936/) has a limited license, allowing the user only personal usage.

[Human Anatomy VR for Institutions](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/store) offers an advanced license, which allows the institutions to use Human Anatomy VR in the education business (public or private institutions) such as Universities, Nursing schools, and High schools.

questions.question: What is the difference between Basic VR and Essential VR?
questions.answer:
[Human Anatomy VR - Basic VR](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/store/products/standard-vr-nGl9QlbP) license includes all 15 body systems with over 13,000 anatomical structures, microanatomy models, and muscle movements.

Basic VR license includes basic features such as Slice, Ant Mode, Hide or Quiz.

[Human Anatomy VR - Essential VR](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/store/products/premium-vr-vVWY34ea) license offers all features we have created with many advantages as Multi-User, allowing you to create shared rooms, search and open more than 1,500 sterescopic cadaver images, browse and search on the Web and create and start custom Tests.

Only Essential VR license contains these features and a VR DICOM module, giving the possibility to examine actual patient DICOM data files, such as MRI or CT, in 3D VR.

questions.question: What kind of subscription should I purchase?
questions.answer:
If you plan to use Human Anatomy VR individually for personal and non-commercial purposes, we would recommend to purchase our application from the [Meta Store](https://www.meta.com/experiences/6643334382420936/) or [PICO Store](https://store-global.picoxr.com/global/detail/1/7179344687503785989).

questions.question: What hardware do I need to use Human Anatomy VR or VR DICOM?
questions.answer:
Human Anatomy VR - [Basic VR](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/store/products/standard-vr-nGl9QlbP) or [Essential VR](https://portal.medicinevirtual.com/store/products/premium-vr-vVWY34ea) runs on standalone devices like Meta Quest or PICO. 

 If you purchase a Human Anatomy VR Essential VR license and run the app on a standalone device, you will have the VR DICOM feature available only as a preview.

 However, if you want to take full advantage of the VR DICOM extension that comes with Human Anatomy VR - Essential VR, you will need a VR-ready Windows PC. Due to the demanding complexity of the displayed data, we recommend getting a PC with the highest possible performance.

questions.question: Is it necessary for me to use a computer when working with Human Anatomy VR and VR DICOM?
questions.answer:
Yes, if you want to use Human Anatomy VR with VR DICOM, we strongly recommend using a high-end Windows PC.

Human Anatomy VR is also ready for Standalone VR Headsets like Meta Quest 1/2/3/Pro, where desktop is not required, but VR DICOM for standalone devices is only a preview feature.

questions.question: How do Standalone VR devices differ from PC VR devices?
questions.answer: Standalone VR headsets are self-contained and portable devices, while PC VR headsets require a connection to a high-end Windows PC via a USB cable to offer the best learning experience, including high resolution and the ability to view the entire body system or full DICOM data.

However, we would be pleased to assist you in connecting with either our local distributors or one of our hardware collaboration partners to help you find the most suitable hardware and software package to meet your requirements.

questions.question: I got logged out of Human Anatomy VR and was prompted to re-enter the pairing key. What steps should I take now?

Please check again your network settings. You can try to connect to a different WiFi network or your phone’s hotspot.

If the problem persists, contact us at: support@medicinevirtual.com

questions.question: I was logged out of Human Anatomy VR and asked to enter the pairing key again. What should I do?
questions.answer:
Please make sure your device is connected to the Internet and then launch Human Anatomy VR. If you still have trouble logging in, connect to a different Wi-Fi network or your phone’s hotspot.

If the problem persists, contact us at: support@medicinevirtual.com

questions.question: I'm unable to mirror/cast my VR headset on the computer or smartphone.
questions.answer:
Ensure that your VR headset is:

-  Connected to the same WiFi network as your computer or smartphone.

-  Sign in with the identical Meta (Oculus) account within your Meta Quest app on your smartphone.

If you continue to experience difficulties while attempting to cast your VR headset, please reach out to Oculus Support for assistance.
